title: 10 Use Counts to Do Simple Arithmetic
description:
Most Normal mode commands can be executed with a count. We can exploit this feature to do simple arithmetic.
Count, Add Count

title: 11 Don't Count If You Can Repeat
description: We can minimize the keystrokes required to perform certain tasks by providing a count, but that doesn't mean that we should. Consider the pros and cons of counting versus repeating.

title: 12 Combine and Conquer
description:
Much of Vim's power stems from the way that operators and motions can be combined.
Motions and Operators
zf

title: 13 Make Corrections Instantly from Insert Mode
description: If we make a mistake while composing text in Insert mode, we can fix it immediately. There's no need to change modes. Besides the backspace key, we can use a couple of other Insert mode commands to make corrections.

chords.description: Delete back to start of line

title: 14 Get Back to Normal Mode
description: Insert mode is specialized for one task--entering text--whereas Normal mode is where we spend most of our time (as the name suggests). So it's important to be able to switch quickly between them.

title: 15 Paste from a Register Without Leaving Insert Mode
description: Vim's yank and put operations are usually executed from Normal mode, but sometimes we might want to paste text into the document without leaving insert mode.

chords.description: While in insert mode, paste from register located at 0 address.

title: 16 Do Back-of-the-Envelope Calculations in Place
description:
The expression register allows us to perform calculations and then insert the result directly into our document. In this tip, we'll see one application for this powerful feature.
<C-r>=

title: 17 Insert Unusual Characters by Character Code
description:
Vim can insert any character by its numeric code. This can be handy for entering symbols that are not found on the keyboard.
<C-v>200

title: 18 Insert Unusual Characters by Digraph
description: While Vim allows us to insert any character by its numeric code, these can be hard to remember and awkward to type. We can also insert unusual characters as diagraphs: pairs of characters that are easy to remember.
